Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Dandruff \Dandruff\ (d[a^]n"dr[u^]f), n. [Prob. from W. toncrust, peel, skin + AS. dr[=o]f dirty, draffy, or W. drwg bad: cf. AS. tan a letter, an eruption. [root]240.] A scurf which forms on the head, and comes off in small scales or particles. [Written also {dandriff}.] [1913 Webster]
dandruff n 1: a condition in which white scales of dead skin are shed by the scalp 2: loose scales shed from the scalp; "I could see the dandruff on her shoulders"
